intro: Erigeron manshuricus, commonly known as the Manchurian fleabane, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and forest edges, preferring temperate climates. Its blue to purple flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Erigeron manshuricus is often used in ornamental gardening due to its aesthetic appeal and hardy nature.
